body:
- `nvim --version`: NVIM v0.4.0-1191-g740fb337d
- `vim -u DEFAULTS` (version: 8.1) behaves differently? It doesn't have a `TermClose` event
- Operating system/version: Fedora Linux 30
- Terminal name/version: gnome-terminal
- `$TERM`: xterm-256color

### Steps to reproduce using `nvim -u NORC`

```
nvim -u NORC
:autocmd TermClose * bd!
:term
:bd!
```

### Actual behaviour

Memory is corrupted, nvim crashes immediately or soon after

### Expected behaviour

Does something reasonable

### Notes

A few minutes in gdb suggests the problem comes down to `termincal_close()` running autocmds and reentering `do_bufdel`, which is presumably not safe to reenter.

Can reproduce it with v0.3.7 also.

@justinmk 
On `:bd!`:
```
E315: ml_get: invalid lnum: 1
Error detected while processing function 1:
line    2:
E16: Invalid range:     call timer_stop(s:delayed_show.show_timer)
Press ENTER or type command to continue
```
(via delayed matchparen plugin, https://github.com/vim/vim/pull/1338)

After `ENTER` it also crashes (differently):

> [1]    11187 floating point exception (core dumped)  nvim -u NORC
```
#0  0x00005643bab7bbed in fileinfo (fullname=0, shorthelp=1, dont_truncate=0) at ../src/nvim/buffer.c:2848
2848        n = (int)(((long)curwin->w_cursor.lnum * 100L) /
[Current thread is 1 (Thread 0x7fc8e461efc0 (LWP 11187))]
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00005643bab7bbed in fileinfo (fullname=0, shorthelp=1, dont_truncate=0) at ../src/nvim/buffer.c:2848
#1  0x00005643bad93ecc in normal_redraw (s=0x7ffd09484b60) at ../src/nvim/normal.c:1273
#2  0x00005643bad9427a in normal_check (state=0x7ffd09484b60) at ../src/nvim/normal.c:1335
#3  0x00005643baedbda1 in state_enter (s=0x7ffd09484b60) at ../src/nvim/state.c:28
#4  0x00005643bad8fde5 in normal_enter (cmdwin=false, noexmode=false) at ../src/nvim/normal.c:467
#5  0x00005643bad2ea3b in main (argc=3, argv=0x7ffd09484eb8) at ../src/nvim/main.c:566
```

With `nvim -u NONE` there is only:

> E315: ml_get: invalid lnum: 1[1]    13048 floating point exception (core dumped)  nvim -u NONE

@justinmk 
Doesn't it happen for you with `nvim -u NONE -c 'autocmd TermClose * bd!' -c 'term' -c 'bd!'`?

@janlazo 
Yes.  Had a pending comment on https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/8839#issuecomment-507491343.

I think I still get this seg fault & subsequent crash with NeoVim 0.5,
is there any consensus on what to do?
[
Could be similar too this?](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/2359)

`nvim -u NONE -c 'autocmd TermClose * bd!' -c 'term' -c 'bd!'`

- nvim --version:
`NVIM v0.5.0
Build type: RelWithDebInfo
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3`

- Operating system/version: Debian Buster `Linux 4.19.0-17-amd64 x86_64`
- Terminal name/version: Konsole
- $TERM: xterm-256color


Thanks for NeoVim! It's awesome :)
I am starting to work on this and port vim patches that should fix this.

Related but doesn't fix this issue:

- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/18453
- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/18832
- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/18978

see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/15267#discussion_r913752143 : 

For the case where altbuf is the first default empty buffer,  `do_buffer` calls `set_curbuf` with the wrong arg. Maybe just need a change in `do_buffer` for that case.

I just noticed that this crash also still happens with multiple splits:
```vim
autocmd TermClose * bdelete!
vnew
terminal
bdelete!
```

Interesting, there is no altbuf in that case. I think it's same root cause as https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2536bde6c9ef5f0a94c0d3789a18a14de6a0a666/test/functional/autocmd/termxx_spec.lua#L30 where there also isn't really an altbuf (except internally `do_buffer` seems to think there is).

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

milestone.description: Low priority items. We plan to work on this but don't have a target date.
milestone.title: backlog

title: TermClose autocmd can free `curbuf`
